page.title: 16The Village of Hooley,Surrey
page.content: Hooley is a quiet dormitory village whose peace is only disturbed by the high density of vehicular traffic on the main A23 London to Brighton road and the mainline railway which also carries the Gatwick Express from London Victoria. Its population is about two thousand of whom a third are now retired people and about a tenth are unemployed. Most of the remainder who work are employed in London. Around the village, market gardening crops are grown which are on offer for sale alongside the A23. A few people are employed in the shops, cafes and restaurants on the main road too. Most everyday needs are provided for in the parade of shops along Brighton Road which includes a supermarket and a a post office. A petrol filling station is conveniently situated next door.
